quizzes.title: iOS Basics
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of iOS development fundamentals

options: A programming language for iOS development
questions.explanation: Swift is a programming language developed by Apple for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS development.

options: A UI framework for iOS development
questions.explanation: UIKit is a framework that provides the required infrastructure for iOS apps, including UI components and event handling.

options: A layout system that automatically adjusts UI elements
questions.explanation: Auto Layout is a layout system that automatically calculates the size and position of UI elements based on constraints.

options: A controller that manages a view and its subviews
questions.explanation: A View Controller manages a view and its subviews, handling user interactions and view lifecycle events.

options: An object that handles app-level events
questions.explanation: The App Delegate is an object that handles app-level events and manages the app's lifecycle.

options: A visual representation of the app's user interface
questions.explanation: Storyboard is a visual representation of the app's user interface, showing screens and the connections between them.

options: A design pattern for communication between objects
questions.explanation: Delegate is a design pattern that allows one object to communicate with another object without creating a strong coupling between them.

options: A blueprint of methods and properties
questions.explanation: Protocol is a blueprint of methods and properties that can be adopted by classes, structs, or enums.

options: A framework for managing the model layer of an app
questions.explanation: Core Data is a framework for managing the model layer of an app, providing object persistence and data management.

options: A controller that manages navigation between view controllers
questions.explanation: Navigation Controller manages navigation between view controllers, providing a hierarchical navigation interface.

questions.questionText: What is a Tab Bar Controller?
options: A controller that manages multiple view controllers in a tabbed interface
questions.explanation: Tab Bar Controller manages multiple view controllers in a tabbed interface, allowing users to switch between different sections of the app.

options: A view that displays an ordered collection of items
questions.explanation: Collection View displays an ordered collection of items in a customizable layout.

options: A view that displays a single column of scrollable content
questions.explanation: Table View displays a single column of scrollable content, divided into rows and sections.

options: A component that interprets user gestures
questions.explanation: Gesture Recognizer interprets user gestures and triggers appropriate actions in response.

options: A view that arranges its children in a stack
questions.explanation: Stack View arranges its children in a stack, either horizontally or vertically, with customizable spacing and alignment.
SwiftUI is a declarative UI framework that allows you to build user interfaces using Swift code.

options: A framework for handling asynchronous events
questions.explanation: Combine is a framework that provides a declarative way to handle asynchronous events and data streams.
Core Data is a framework that provides data persistence and object graph management.
URLSession is a framework that provides APIs for downloading and uploading data to and from web services.
Grand Central Dispatch is a framework that provides APIs for concurrent programming and task management.
Keychain is a secure storage system for sensitive data like passwords, certificates, and keys.

options: A system for storing user preferences
questions.explanation: UserDefaults is a system for storing user preferences and other small pieces of data persistently.
Core Animation is a framework for creating smooth animations and transitions in iOS apps.

options: A framework for 2D graphics and drawing
questions.explanation: Core Graphics is a framework for 2D graphics and drawing, providing low-level drawing capabilities.
Core Image is a framework for image processing, providing filters and effects for images.

options: A framework for audio and video
questions.explanation: AVFoundation is a framework for working with audio and video, providing playback and recording capabilities.

options: A framework for maps and location services
questions.explanation: MapKit is a framework for maps and location services, providing map display and location-based features.
Core Location is a framework that provides location and heading information to apps.

options: A framework for motion and fitness data
questions.explanation: Core Motion is a framework that provides access to motion and fitness data from device sensors.
Core Bluetooth is a framework that provides access to Bluetooth Low Energy devices.

options: A framework for Near Field Communication
questions.explanation: Core NFC is a framework that provides access to Near Field Communication tags.

options: A framework for app content search
questions.explanation: Core Spotlight is a framework that allows apps to make their content searchable in Spotlight.
Core ML is a framework that allows apps to use machine learning models for predictions.
Vision is a framework that provides high-performance image analysis and computer vision capabilities.

options: A framework for natural language processing
questions.explanation: Natural Language is a framework that provides natural language processing capabilities for text analysis.

quizzes.title: iOS Advanced
quizzes.description: Advanced iOS development concepts and best practices

options: A framework for graphics and compute
questions.explanation: Metal is a framework that provides low-level access to the GPU for graphics and compute tasks.
Instruments is a performance analysis tool that helps identify and fix performance issues in iOS apps.

options: A way to provide a small part of your app
questions.explanation: App Clips are a way to provide a small part of your app that users can access quickly without installing the full app.
WidgetKit is a framework that lets you create widgets that appear on the iOS home screen or in the Today view.
Core ML is a framework for machine learning, allowing apps to use trained models for predictions.
ARKit is a framework for augmented reality, allowing apps to create AR experiences.

options: A framework for cloud storage and sync
questions.explanation: CloudKit is a framework for cloud storage and sync, providing backend services for iOS apps.

options: A service for sending notifications to users
questions.explanation: Push Notifications is a service for sending notifications to users, even when the app is not running.

options: A feature for selling digital content
questions.explanation: In-App Purchase is a feature for selling digital content within apps, managed through the App Store.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Review Guidelines?
options: A set of rules for app submission
questions.explanation: App Store Review Guidelines is a set of rules that apps must follow to be accepted into the App Store.

options: A practice for improving app visibility
questions.explanation: App Store Optimization is a practice for improving app visibility and discoverability in the App Store.

options: A tool for analyzing app performance
questions.explanation: App Store Analytics is a tool for analyzing app performance, user engagement, and other metrics.

options: A platform for managing app distribution
questions.explanation: App Store Connect is a platform for managing app distribution, analytics, and user feedback.

options: A tool for beta testing apps
questions.explanation: TestFlight is a tool for beta testing apps, allowing developers to distribute pre-release versions.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Server Notifications?
options: A service for receiving app store events
questions.explanation: App Store Server Notifications is a service that sends notifications about app store events to your server.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect API?
options: An API for automating app store tasks
questions.explanation: App Store Connect API is an API for automating app store tasks like managing apps and testers.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Review API?
options: An API for managing app reviews
questions.explanation: App Store Review API is an API for managing app reviews and responding to user feedback.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Promotional Offers?
options: A feature for offering promotional subscriptions
questions.explanation: App Store Promotional Offers is a feature for offering promotional subscriptions to users.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Server-to-Server Notifications?
options: A service for receiving server-to-server notifications
questions.explanation: App Store Server-to-Server Notifications is a service that sends notifications about app store events directly to your server.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect Analytics API?
options: An API for accessing app analytics data
questions.explanation: App Store Connect Analytics API is an API for accessing app analytics data programmatically.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect TestFlight API?
options: An API for managing TestFlight beta testing
questions.explanation: App Store Connect TestFlight API is an API for managing TestFlight beta testing programmatically.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect Users and Roles API?
options: An API for managing user access and roles
questions.explanation: App Store Connect Users and Roles API is an API for managing user access and roles in App Store Connect.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect Certificates API?
options: An API for managing certificates and provisioning profiles
questions.explanation: App Store Connect Certificates API is an API for managing certificates and provisioning profiles programmatically.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect Devices API?
options: An API for managing registered devices
questions.explanation: App Store Connect Devices API is an API for managing registered devices for development and testing.

questions.questionText: What is App Store Connect Builds API?
options: An API for managing app builds
questions.explanation: App Store Connect Builds API is an API for managing app builds and their metadata programmatically.
